wisdom_insights.summary: In high-conversion workflows, replicating a proven template (Todd's OTO page) with exact typography, colors, and structure tends to preserve performance and avoid regressions caused by superficial changes.

Constantly observe asset integrity (hero image presence, font sizing, color palette) and promptly decide to revert to or copy proven assets when deviations threaten conversions; act by updating HTML/CSS to align with the reference.
All changes and decisions are anchored to the origin: the original Unbounce/Todd pages and the supplied content. This ensures traceability and defensibility of design choices.
Capturing Senses, Actions, Emotions, Impulses, Cognitions (S.A.E.I.C.) reveals tensions between aesthetic fidelity and functional constraints (e.g., missing hero image, asset URLs).
Maintaining the established page voice (conversational, direct, conversion-focused) is critical to sustaining audience trust and conversions across sections.

attractors.name: Conversion Fidelity Momentum
attractors.description: Momentum built by strict fidelity to a known high-performing layout and copy; slipping fidelity reduces perceived trust and CTR.

attractors.name: Asset Completeness Urgency
attractors.description: Missing hero image and font/size mismatches drive urgency to hunt for exact assets and restore the original look.

attractors.name: Proven Template Reliance
attractors.description: Reliance on Todd's OTO structure as a baseline, resisting ad-hoc redesigns to avoid destructive divergence.

attractors.name: Provenance-Backed Decision Making
attractors.description: Decisions are guided by origin-content (Stop-Replaying page, Todd's page) to ensure traceable, justifiable changes.

attractors.name: Voice-Consistency Drive
attractors.description: Maintaining a consistent brand voice across blocks aligns with prior successful messaging.
